law.catch_line: Authority to transact business required -- Certificate of authority required for award of state contract -- Exception for foreign insurer.

text.section: A foreign entity shall not transact business in this Commonwealth until it obtains a certificate of authority from the Secretary of State.
The list of activities in subsection (2) of this section is not exhaustive.

Except as provided in subsection (6) of this section, this section shall not apply to foreign general partnerships. Whether a foreign limited liability partnership is transacting business in this Commonwealth shall be determined under subsection (2) of this section. A foreign limited liability partnership that is transacting business in this Commonwealth shall file a statement of foreign qualification pursuant to KRS 362.1-951.

This section shall not apply in determining the contacts or activities that may subject a foreign entity to service of process or taxation in this Commonwealth or to regulation under any other law of this Commonwealth.

Notwithstanding any other law to the contrary, a foreign entity, in order to be eligible for award of a state contract under KRS Chapter 45A or 176, shall have a certificate of authority or a statement of foreign qualification.
A foreign insurer with a certificate of authority from the commissioner of the Department of Insurance is not subject to subsection (1) or (6) of this section.

law.history: Amended 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 34, sec. 5, effective June 24, 2015. -- Amended 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 81, sec. 84, effective July 12, 2012. -- Amended 2011 Ky. Acts ch. 80, sec. 1, effective June 8, 2011. -- Created 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 151, sec. 40, effective January 1, 2011.

metadata.lrc-note: (1/1/2011). The word "contracts" in subsection (5) of this statute has been changed in codification to "contacts." This manifest clerical or typographical error has been corrected by the Reviser of Statutes under the authority of KRS 7.136(1).
